private_information: My stack from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E with A smallest and E largest.
I can only move the top disk I hold and I cannot place a larger disk on a smaller one.
left.goal: Contribute to the global goal by describing my local state and possible top-disk moves.

private_information: I can only receive or send the top disk subject to size constraints.
middle.goal: Contribute to the global goal by describing my local state and possible top-disk moves.

private_information: I can receive disks but must obey the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one.
right.goal: Contribute to the global goal by describing my local state and possible top-disk moves.

private_information: I coordinate the agents to produce a final planning problem suitable for FastDownward.
I will integrate local descriptions into a single PDDL domain and problem.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownward that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance and achieves the global goal.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A B C D E where A is smallest and E is largest.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
You may never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E, middle empty, right empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top-to-bottom A B C D E, left and middle empty.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. Provide a clear description of your local state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual local state, the identity of the top disk if any, and constraints on moves.
analysis.prompt: Your name is left. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->left->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->left->goal} Provide a concise description of your current stack, indicate which disk is on top if any, and enumerate legal single-disk moves you could perform from your perspective.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. Provide a clear description of your local state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual local state, the identity of the top disk if any, and constraints on moves.
analysis.prompt: Your name is middle. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->middle->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->middle->goal} Provide a concise description of your current stack, indicate which disk is on top if any, and enumerate legal single-disk moves you could perform from your perspective.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. Provide a clear description of your local state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on factual local state, the identity of the top disk if any, and constraints on moves.
analysis.prompt: Your name is right. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->right->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->right->goal} Provide a concise description of your current stack, indicate which disk is on top if any, and enumerate legal single-disk moves you could perform from your perspective.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the local descriptions from the peg agents to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownward planner. The domain must model pegs and disks, a move action that moves the top disk from one peg to another, and size constraints preventing larger disks on smaller ones. The problem must define objects for disks A B C D E and pegs left middle right, encode the initial stacks exactly as given, and encode the goal with all disks stacked on right in the correct order. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the local descriptions from the three peg agents: {desc_left} {desc_middle} {desc_right} Your task is to integrate these descriptions to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the environment. Ensure the PDDL models single-disk moves, enforces the cannot-place-larger-on-smaller rule, and represents the initial and goal stacks exactly as in {environment->init->initial_stacks} and {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Produce the PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
